entry.title: SLAM Platform
entry.content:
Description:

I cooperated with some students at Peking University to build a slam platform. I am responsible for writing ROS drivers of all sensors, including fisheye camera, depth camera, GNSS, and radar. I also need to develop a circuit broad that capable of triggering all sensors synchronously. The paper is being written.

entry.title: Falling-cat Quadruped Robot
entry.content:
Description:

The falling cat problem inspires me, and I plan to complete my master’s career by developing a creative and challenging robot, a spinal quadruped robot that can flip in the air.
In order to accomplish this goal, not only the hardware and circuit but also the motors are specially customized this time. In the algorithm part, I intend to combine nonlinear MPC and deep reinforcement learning. Now the hardware has completed its design and manufacture, and the simulation preliminarily verified the feasibility of the algorithm.

entry.title: Spined Quadruped Robot
entry.content:
Publication:

Wanyue Li, Zida Zhou, Hui Cheng*, “Dynamic Locomotion of a Quadruped Robot with Active Spine via Model Predictive Control”, IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA 2023)

Description:

I developed a 15 DoFs quadruped robot with three actuated spine joints. The robot can freely change its spinal posture while trotting at high speed. and present a convex MPC approach considering the movements of the spine. The paper has been accepted by ICRA 2023. The link to the video is RAPID Lab.

It was challenging because I had to do everything by myself except for the hardware structure design by an engineer. Since no one guided me, I spend a year and a half completing the robot
